response.sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
response.relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Form 424B2 GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP INC
feed.summary: This SEC filing (Form 424B2) details the offering of "Contingent Income Auto-Callable Securities" by GS Finance Corp., guaranteed by The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., based on the performance of Microsoft Corporation common stock. These principal-at-risk securities offer quarterly contingent coupon payments if Microsoft's stock price meets certain thresholds, but investors risk losing all or a significant portion of their principal if the stock falls below a downside threshold. The securities may be automatically called if the stock price reaches or exceeds the initial share price on specified observation dates.

feed.title: Dow drops 215 points on losses for shares of Amazon.com Inc., Microsoft
feed.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped by 215 points due to declines in shares of major tech companies, Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft. This indicates a challenging day for the stock market, particularly for the technology sector.

feed.title: Gen Digital earnings on deck: Can AI features reverse revenue slide?
feed.summary: Gen Digital (NASDAQ: GEN) is set to report its fiscal third-quarter earnings, with analysts anticipating EPS of $0.63 and revenue of $1.2 billion. The company faces scrutiny over its ability to reverse an expected sequential revenue decline, the traction of its AI-driven cybersecurity features, and the success of its acquisition of MoneyLion. Investors are keenly watching these areas to determine if Gen Digital can sustain growth amid competitive pressures and market saturation.

feed.title: 2 Fidelity ETFs To Buy In February
feed.summary: This article recommends two Fidelity ETFs, the Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) and the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX), as strong buys for February. FBCG focuses on large-cap growth stocks, particularly in the tech sector, with strong returns over the past three years. FDTX invests in disruptive technology companies, showing significant growth since its 2020 launch and concentrating on the semiconductor and software industries.

feed.title: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
feed.summary: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) reported better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales increasing 1.1% year-on-year to $8.54 billion, surpassing analyst estimates. Despite robust sales and record full-year results in its Distribution and Power Systems segments, GAAP EPS missed expectations at $4.27 per share. The company's stock dipped slightly post-announcement, indicating mixed market reaction to the results.

feed.title: Apple Becomes Apple Again
feed.summary: Apple's stock has surged by 36% in the last six months, significantly outperforming the S&P 500, despite concerns about its lack of a proprietary AI product. This resurgence comes as other major AI companies like Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft face investor skepticism due to high investments and slow integration of AI into paid products. Apple's decision to integrate Google's Gemini AI into "Apple Intelligence" through a reported $1 billion annual deal is seen as a remarkably favorable move for the company.

feed.title: HORAN Wealth LLC Acquires 6,139 Shares of RTX Corporation $RTX

This increase follows a strong quarter for RTX, which beat earnings estimates and raised its FY2026 guidance, while securing major defense contracts. Despite positive news, the stock is seeing some profit-taking and valuation concerns.

feed.title: Amdocs agentic aOS system boosts Gen AI support for telecom operators
feed.summary: Amdocs has launched aOS, an agentic operating system designed for telecommunications to accelerate Generative AI strategies. This system aims to embed intelligence into telecom operations, improving customer and employee experiences and unlocking new growth opportunities and operational efficiencies for Communication Services Providers (CSPs). Amdocs highlights that aOS will help CSPs move from AI experimentation to real impact by creating a cognitive ecosystem for AI agents, built on modular architecture and strategic partnerships with tech leaders like Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, and AWS.

feed.title: Jefferies reiterates Buy rating on Broadcom stock amid AI growth
feed.summary: Jefferies has reiterated its Buy rating and $500.00 price target for Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), citing the company's strong position in the artificial intelligence and networking markets. The firm highlighted Broadcom's "well ahead" status in custom on-package (COT) business and expected growth in its networking segment, further supported by Google's increased AI spending guidance and positive InvestingPro data suggesting undervaluation. Other analysts from Wolfe Research and Wells Fargo have also recently upgraded Broadcom's stock, underscoring the semiconductor giant's strategic advancements and potential for future growth.

feed.title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Set to Report Earnings as UBS Raises Price Target on AWS Outlook
feed.summary: UBS analyst Stephen Ju raised the price target for Amazon.com (AMZN) to $311.00, maintaining a Buy rating ahead of its 4Q25 earnings report. The firm increased estimates for AWS revenue and capital expenditures, projecting that AWS revenue could double by 2028, potentially generating an additional $20 billion in free cash flow. This outlook suggests improved investor confidence and continued outperformance for AMZN shares.

feed.title: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
feed.summary: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $104.67. Despite missing EPS estimates in its latest quarterly results, the company exceeded revenue expectations and provided FY2026 EPS guidance. While long-term growth is supported by menu simplification and U.S. store expansion plans, risks like union activity, a pessimistic Citigroup forecast, and recent insider sales present near-term headwinds.

feed.title: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) Expected to Announce Quarterly Earnings on Thursday
feed.summary: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) is scheduled to announce its Q4 2025 earnings before market open on Thursday, February 12, 2026. Analysts project earnings of $0.96 per share and revenue of $2.1249 billion. The company also recently declared a quarterly dividend of $0.12 per share, yielding approximately 0.2% annually, and has a "Moderate Buy" average analyst rating with a target price of $224.53.

feed.title: Is Fortinet’s FortiCNAPP Risk‑Scoring Push Quietly Reshaping The Investment Case For FTNT?
feed.summary: Fortinet recently enhanced its FortiCNAPP platform with improved cloud risk prioritization, crucial for its strategy to expand beyond firewalls into a comprehensive security platform. These updates integrate network controls, data sensitivity, and runtime behavior into a unified risk view, bolstering the company's cloud security ambitions. While the market currently focuses more on traditional metrics like billings and growth expectations, the long-term impact of FortiCNAPP on Fortinet's investment narrative depends on its ability to demonstrate clear adoption and contribute to earnings growth in the cloud security sector.

feed.title: Expedia Group (EXPE) Expected to Release Earnings on Thursday
feed.summary: Expedia Group (EXPE) is scheduled to release its Q4 2025 earnings after the market closes on Thursday, February 12th, with analysts forecasting EPS of $3.32 and revenue of $3.4052 billion. The company exceeded expectations in the previous quarter, reporting an EPS of $7.57 against an estimate of $7.10, with an 8.7% year-over-year revenue increase. Insiders have sold approximately $1.28 million worth of shares over the last three months, while institutional investors hold a significant 90.76% stake in the company.

feed.title: Stifel downgrades Microsoft stock to Hold on Azure concerns
feed.summary: Stifel downgraded Microsoft stock from Buy to Hold and significantly cut its price target due to concerns over Azure's supply constraints and increased AI competition. The firm believes Wall Street's 2027 revenue and earnings expectations are too optimistic, citing strong performance from Google Cloud Platform and Anthropic. Stifel also raised its capital expenditure estimate for Microsoft and lowered its gross margin forecast, indicating a new spending phase for AI development.

feed.title: Cerence Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Cerence reported strong Q1 2026 financials with $115.1 million in revenue and $44.6 million in adjusted EBITDA, exceeding guidance, partly due to a one-time $49.5 million patent license payment from Samsung. The company highlighted significant commercial momentum for its xUI platform, securing five new customer programs including JLR and a Volkswagen brand, and introduced new AI agents like Microsoft Mobile Work, Dealer Assist, and Ownership Companion. Cerence reaffirmed its full-year 2026 guidance, emphasizing continued progress in technology, cost management, and top-line growth despite a lower Q2 outlook and complex tax situation.

feed.title: RXO Earnings: What To Look For From RXO
feed.summary: RXO is set to announce its earnings results, with analysts expecting a revenue decline of 11.2% year-on-year to $1.48 billion and an adjusted loss of -$0.04 per share. Despite missing Wall Street’s revenue estimates six times in the past two years, investor sentiment in the ground transportation segment is positive, with RXO's shares up 18.6% over the last month. The company's average analyst price target is $15.50, compared to its current share price of $17.05.
